unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Focus Sharpens in Indian Sector**
normalised: **manufacturing and supply chain: quality control focus sharpens in Indian sector**

unnormalised: New Delhi – As India aims to become a global manufacturing hub, stringent quality control (QC) measures are increasingly vital. IIT Bombay's recent workshop on “Six Sigma for Manufacturing Excellence,” held on 26/01/2024, highlighted the growing emphasis on minimizing defects and optimizing production processes.
normalised: new delhi – as india aims to become a global manufacturing hub, stringent quality control (Q C) measures are increasingly vital. I I T bombay's recent workshop on “six sigma for manufacturing excellence,” held on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four, highlighted the growing emphasis on minimizing defects and optimizing production processes.

unnormalised: The event, attended by representatives from companies in Hosur and Coimbatore, focused on practical applications of statistical QC methods. Experts, including Dr. Sharma from the National Institute of Technology, Trichy, emphasized the importance of robust testing procedures throughout the supply chain, from raw material sourcing to final product delivery.

unnormalised: "A single faulty bolt can halt production worth Rs. 50 lakhs," explained Mr. Patel, a QC manager at Tata Steel, at 14:30 hrs during a panel discussion. He cited the implementation of advanced AI-powered QC systems expected to reduce defect rates by 15% within the next quarter. The deadline for integration is set for 31/03/2024. This drive for quality aims to ensure 'Made in India' products meet international standards and build brand trust, ultimately reducing customer complaints and costly returns within a 5 km radius of the factory. Quality checks are performed every hour, starting at 09:00 hrs.
